**Step 3: Apply the given property.**

Since ∑a_n converges, its partial sums S_n = ∑_{k=1}^n a_k converge to some limit L ∈ F. But we observed earlier that S_n = x_n for all n. Therefore, the sequence (x_n) converges to L.

We have shown that an arbitrary Cauchy sequence (x_n) in F converges to an element of F. Therefore, F is Cauchy complete.

This completes the proof that if an ordered field F has the property that every absolutely convergent series converges, then F is Cauchy complete.
